intro: Gigachilon polonicum subsp. carthlicum, commonly known as the Polish giant sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
